greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(n) = A156552(A122111(n)).
comment: a(n) (n>=2) can be obtained by the composition of a bijection between {2,3,4,...} and the set of integer partitions and a bijection between the set of integer partitions and {1,2,3,4,...}. Explanation on the example n=18. Write 18 = 3*3*2 = 2'*2'*1', where m' = m-th prime. Consider the partition p = (2,2,1) and let b denote the southeast border of the Ferrers board of p. Form a binary number by replacing each east step of b by 1 and each north step of b, with the exception of the last one, by 0: 1010. Its value is a(18) = 10. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Sep 08 2016.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (first 1000 terms from Antti Karttunen)
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of other permutations:
maple: a:= proc(n) local i, l, r; r, l:= 0, [0, sort(map(i->
mathematica: Table[Floor@ Total@ Flatten@ MapIndexed[#1 2^(#2 - 1) &, Flatten[ Table[ 2^(PrimePi@ #1 - 1), {#2}] & @@@ FactorInteger@ #]] &[If[n == 1, 1, Module[{l = #, m = 0}, Times @@ Power @@@ Table[l -= m; l = DeleteCases[l, 0]; {Prime@ Length@ l, m = Min@ l}, Length@ Union@ l]] &@ Catenate[ConstantArray[PrimePi[#1], #2] & @@@ FactorInteger@ n]]], {n, 57}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 08 2016, after _JungHwan Min_ at A122111 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 03 2015
